parts.text: {"word":"footfall","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"足音、歩み","english_definition":"the sound of a footstep; the act of walking.","examples":[{"sentence":"I heard the footfall of someone approaching.","translation":"誰かが近づいてくる足音が聞こえた。"},{"sentence":"The soft footfall of the cat was barely audible.","translation":"猫の静かな足音はほとんど聞こえなかった。"},{"sentence":"The guard's footfalls echoed in the empty corridor.","translation":"警備員の足音が空っぽの廊下に響き渡った。"}],"collocations":["heavy footfall (重い足音)","soft footfall (静かな足音)","hear a footfall (足音を聞く)","the echo of footfalls (足音の反響)"],"synonyms":["footstep","tread","patter","thud"],"antonyms":["silence"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"(商業施設などの)来客数、通行量","english_definition":"the number of people entering a shop or business during a particular period.","examples":[{"sentence":"The shopping center has seen a significant increase in footfall this month.","translation":"そのショッピングセンターは今月、来客数が大幅に増加した。"},{"sentence":"The new store location was chosen for its high footfall.","translation":"新しい店舗の場所は、通行量が多いことから選ばれた。"},{"sentence":"Retailers are hoping for strong footfall during the holiday season.","translation":"小売業者はホリデーシーズン中の高い来客数を期待している。"}],"collocations":["increase footfall (来客数を増やす)","high footfall (高い来客数)","low footfall (低い来客数)","drive footfall (来客数を促進する)","retail footfall (小売店の来客数)"],"synonyms":["customer traffic","pedestrian traffic","visitor numbers","patronage"],"antonyms":["lack of customers"]}],"etymology":{"value":"「foot」（足）と「fall」（落ちる、降る）の組み合わせ。文字通りには「足が落ちる」ことから「足音」を意味し、そこから派生して商業的な文脈では「人が店に立ち寄る」という意味になった。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈfʊtfɔːl/","syllables":"foot-fall"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"footfalls"},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**footfall**」は、文字通りには「足音」を意味しますが、商業的な文脈では「来客数」や「通行量」を指すことが多いです。特に小売業や商業施設において、店舗への訪問者数を測る重要な指標として用いられます。足音としての意味と来客数としての意味では文脈が大きく異なるため、どちらの意味で使われているかを判断する必要があります。","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The shop had many footfalls yesterday.","correct":"✓ The shop had high footfall yesterday. / ✓ The shop had many visitors yesterday.","note":"「footfall」は不可算名詞として使われることが多いです。具体的な人数を指す場合は「visitors」や「customers」を使う方が自然です。"},{"incorrect":"✗ The footfall was very noisy. (商業施設について)","correct":"✓ There was a lot of foot traffic.","note":"商業施設について「騒がしい」ことを言いたい場合は、"foot traffic" を使う方が自然です。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":[],"phrasal_verbs":[],"priority":"★☆☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"比較的低頻度 (Relatively low frequency) - 特定の分野（小売業、商業）でより頻繁に使われる。","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"「**footfall**」は、主に2つの意味を持つ名詞です。1つ目は、文字通りの「足音」という意味で、誰かが歩くときに聞こえる音を指します。2つ目は、ビジネスや小売りの文脈で使われる「来客数」という意味で、特定期間に店舗や施設を訪れる人の数を指します。商業的な意味合いで使われることが多いため、ニュース記事やビジネスレポートなどで見かけることがあります。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The **footfall** of the soldiers marching past shook the ground.","translation":"行進していく兵士たちの足音が地面を揺らした。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"足音"},{"sentence":"The store's **footfall** increased after the renovation.","translation":"改装後、その店の来客数が増加した。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"来客数"},{"sentence":"We need to find ways to drive **footfall** to our website.","translation":"ウェブサイトへのアクセス数を増やす方法を見つける必要があります。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"来客数 (比喩的)"},{"sentence":"The only sound was the soft **footfall** of the security guard.","translation":"唯一の音は、警備員の静かな足音だけだった。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"足音"}]}
